about_us.title: UAEM Chapter of McGill
about_us.title_description:
is a global network of university students striving to increase access
and affordability to life-saving medicines. Considering that
universities are key stakeholders in the drug development
pipeline, students can promote equitable licensing practices by
encouraging university policy changes. The UAEM chapter of McGill
is one of the most active chapters in North America. Currently,
the chapter's main projects include Donations Trackers, as well as the <1/> <2>UAEM Canadian Report Card</2>, Open Science, and more.
about_us.subtitle: About Us
about_us.subtitle_description:
Donations Trackers was developed by members of <1>Universities Allied for Essential Medicines</1> (UAEM) and an astounding group of student web developers at McGill
University.
about_us.dt_description:
Donations Trackers is a website that provides a platform for users to efficiently and effectively share donations in the Greater Montréal area. The project was concocted by a group of McGill UAEM members through a design sprint called <1>Innovate4Health</1> organized by <3>ReAct</3>, <5>IFMSA</5> (International Federation of Medical Students Association),and the <7>IDEA Initiative</7> at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health.
Originally, the website aimed to increase transparency in
personal protective equipment (PPE) distribution amid the
shortage during the COVID-19 pandemic. With the pandemic
gradually (and fortunately) coming to an end, the team
decided to adapt the website to increase accessibility to
making/receiving donations in general (e.g. canned food,
essential goods, worn clothes, etc.).

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions

item_1.question: What is Donations Tracker?
item_1.answer: Donations Tracker is an online platform aimed at promoting donation sharing in Montréal. On this platform, users can request and offer donations. In doing so, our goal is to strengthen community solidarity and reduce socioeconomic disparities here in Montréal.

item_2.question: How do I make an offer and/or request for a donation on Donations Tracker?

step: Click on “Login” on the top right then click “Click here to register.”
You can register as an individual or an organization. For more information on their differences, please read “What is the difference between registering as an individual vs. organization?” below.
Once you log in, click on “Posts” in the menu bar on the left. Click on “Make an Offer” or “Make a Request” and fill in the appropriate information.
Note: Only specific users can make a request. For more information, please see “What is the difference between registering as an individual vs. organization?” below.
Note: The current version of the website allows purchasing/selling of products. If you want to offer/request a donation, please input ‘0’ as the price.

answer.instruction: EXPLORE THE “POSTS” PAGE FOR ANY OFFERS/REQUESTS YOU WANT TO RESPOND TO.
step: Scroll through the offers/requests listed on “Posts.” You might have products another user may need! Or, another user may be offering items that you want!
Use the filters on the left to look at specific posts. You can also add certain posts to your “Favorites” by clicking on the star button.

answer.instruction: CLICK ON THE OFFER/REQUEST THAT YOU WANT. CONTACT THE OTHER USER THROUGH EMAIL LISTED ON THE POST.
step: All communication/transactions between users must occur outside of the Donations Tracker platform.

answer.instruction: COMMUNICATE WITH THE OTHER USER TO COMPLETE THE TRANSACTION/DONATION.
CONGRATULATIONS! YOUR OFFER/REQUEST HAS BEEN FULFILLED! LASTLY, PLEASE CLOSE YOUR POST ON THE WEBSITE.
step: It is important that you close your completed offers/requests so that other users know that it’s no longer active. We thank you for your cooperation!

item_3.question: What is the “Other” category in requests/offers?
answer: “Other” is a category option provided when users make an offer/request.

The “Other” category is to be used when the item(s) being offered/requested do not fit any of the alternative categories listed. When using the “Other” category, users are to describe or specify the item(s) in the description of the post. This post will then be approved/denied to go public by the Donations Tracker moderators to ensure that no contraband/illegal items are being offered or requested on the Donations Tracker website. Once approved, the user that made the post will be e-mailed that their post has been approved and the offer/request will be posted allowing all Donations Tracker users to be able to see and interact with the post.

item_4.question: What can I do on the “Account” page?
answer: The “Account” page appears for users who have logged in.
Dashboard: Users can view their own posts as well as posts marked as their “Favorite.”
General: Users can change their first, last, and display names. If you want to change your associated email, please contact the administrators at <1>uaem@ssmu.ca</1>.
Security: Users can change their password.

item_5.question: How is Donations Tracker different from other product-sharing websites?
item_5.answer: Although there is the option to sell/purchase items on this website, Donations Tracker stands out from other product-sharing platforms in the sense that it promotes donation sharing. The development team realized that despite there being numerous platforms to sell/purchase products, there is a lack of donation-promoting websites. By making donations more accessible, Donations Tracker hopes to enhance community morale and well-being.

item_6.question: What is the difference between registering as <1>an individual vs. organization?</1>
answer: Registering as an individual doesn't require that the user be associated with an organization (e.g. NGO, company). There are no geographic restraints for individual users (i.e. individual users don't have to be living in the Greater Montréal area). However, individual users can only offer donations/products (not request).

Registering as an organization makes it mandatory that the user be associated with a legitimate organization. The legitimacy of the organization will be approved by the website administrators during registration. For the purpose of the website, for now, it is required that the organization be based in the Greater Montréal area. Organization users can make both offers and requests.

item_7.question: How can users be sure that the website is secure?
answer: As a group of university students behind this website, we understand that the security of this platform could be questionable. Our web development team has worked vigorously to ensure that your privacy and authentication information is managed safely on our platform. Some of the methods that we have implemented to ensure you have a safe and secure experience are listed below.

If a user registers as an organization, website administrators will go through a mandatory authentication process to ensure that the organization is legitimate. Only then will the registration be completed, and the user would be able to use the website

If you have reasonable doubt about another user's reliability/legitimacy, you can always report them by clicking on the <1>Report User</1> button, which can be found on the _____. Once a user has been reported, their activity will be temporarily blocked until the website administrators conduct a background check.

item_8.question: If there are issues/errors with donations or monetary transactions, what should we do?
answer: We completely understand that issues with donations/transactions may arise due to various causes (e.g. technical difficulties). <3>Donations Trackers is not responsible for any errors/issues that arise with a transaction/donation.</3> Such errors/issues include but are not limited to:
Damages to products - We encourage you to check that all products are in their desired condition before completing the transaction/donation.
Products that are different from their description on the website - We encourage that you check all products are provided as posted on the website.
Not receiving the fee after selling the product.
Errors with transactions - Please contact the corresponding bank for any errors related to monetary transactions.

If during a donation/transaction, you find issues with a specific user, please report them using the “Report User” feature as soon as possible, so that the user's activity can be temporarily blocked. Donations Trackers thanks you for your understanding and cooperation.

faq.further_question: <1>If you have any other questions/concerns, please email <2>uaem@ssmu.ca</2>.</1>
